Body:
I want to check my understanding of these 2 terms:

diphthong (concerned with sound; 1 sound; represented 2 letters; not long or short)
digraph (concerned with graphemes; 2 letters; can be long or short)

Is this accurate? If not what is the similarities/differences? And can a diphthong be represented by a digraph/ is it always represented by a digraph?
Title: diphthong vs. digraph (English)

LastEditedUser.AboutMe:
Travelling armchair linguist.

Never studied in an institution but read books and web with probably more breadth than depth.

Always on the road surviving in a strange foreign language, currently Mongolian and Mandarin Chinese.

And I collect dictionaries.

OwnerUser.AboutMe: I am a Literacy PhD student at the University at Buffalo.
